means: （用炸药）炸毁( blast的现在分词 )

word_mean: 利用炸药爆破瞬时释放的能量，破坏其周围的介质，达到开挖、填筑、拆除或取料等特定目标的技术手段。
用炸药破碎物体的作业。

sentence.Network_en: A blizzard was blasting great drifts of snow across the lake.
sentence.Network_cn: 暴风雪夹着大团的积雪吹过湖面。

sentence.Network_en: Suddenly all the men pull out pistols and begin blasting away.
sentence.Network_cn: 突然，所有人都拔出手枪，连续射击。

sentence.Network_en: Three miles away there was a salvo of blasting in the quarry.
sentence.Network_cn: 三英里之外的采石场进行了爆破作业。

entry.def: A blast is a big explosion, especially one caused by a bomb.

example.ex: 250 people were killed in the blast.
example.tran: 250人在这次爆炸中丧生。

entry.def: If something is blasted into a particular place or state, an explosion causes it to be in that place or state. If a hole is blasted in something, it is created by an explosion.

example.ex: There is a risk that toxic chemicals might be blasted into the atmosphere.
example.tran: 爆炸后有毒化学物质可能会进入大气层。

example.ex: ...a terrible accident in which his  left arm was blasted off by some kind of a bomb...
example.tran: 他的左臂被某种炸弹炸飞的可怕事故

entry.def: If workers are blasting rock, they are using explosives to make holes in it or destroy it, for example so that a road or tunnel can be built.

example.ex: Their work was taken up with boring and blasting rock with gelignite...
example.tran: 他们的工作是用葛里炸药炸石头，非常枯燥。

example.ex: They're  using dynamite to blast away rocks to put a road in.
example.tran: 他们用炸药炸石筑路。

entry.def: To blast someone means to shoot them with a gun.

example.ex: ...a son who blasted his father to death after a lifetime of bullying...
example.tran: 因从小到大一直被父亲虐待而开枪弑父的男子

example.ex: Alan Barnett, 28, was blasted with a sawn-off shotgun in Oldham on Thursday.
example.tran: 28岁的艾伦·巴尼特于星期四在奥德姆被人用短管猎枪射杀。

entry.tran: （通过枪击） 冲出（道路）；轰开，炸开（通路）
entry.def: If someone blasts their way somewhere, they get there by shooting at people or causing an explosion.

example.ex: The police were reported to have blasted their way into the house using explosives...
example.tran: 据报道，警方借助爆破冲进了房子。

example.ex: One armoured column attempted to blast a path through a barricade of buses and trucks.
example.tran: 一个武装纵队试图从公交车和卡车组成的路障中间炸出一条通道来。

entry.def: Ifsomething blasts water or air somewhere, it sends out a sudden, powerful stream of it.

example.ex: Blasting cold air over it makes the water evaporate...
example.tran: 向它喷射冷空气可以使水蒸发。

example.ex: A blizzard was blasting great drifts of snow across the lake.
example.tran: 暴风雪夹着大团的积雪吹过湖面。

entry.tran: （使）（汽车喇叭等）突然发出响亮的声音；（使）（音乐）轰响
entry.def: If you blast something such as a car horn, or if it blasts, it makes a sudden, loud sound. If something blasts music, or music blasts, the music is very loud.

example.ex: ...drivers who do not blast their horns...
example.tran: 不按喇叭的司机

example.ex: The sound of western music blasted as she entered.
example.tran: 她一进门便听到西部音乐震天的响声。

entry.def: You can say that a sports player blasts the ball somewhere if he or she gives it a powerful kick or hit.

example.ex: Ramsay blasted the ball into the back of the net...
example.tran: 拉姆齐劲射入网。

example.ex: He may try to blast his way out of trouble, playing attacking shots to balls he would not normally contemplate hitting.
example.tran: 他可能是想努力摆脱困境，平时不会考虑击打的球也打起了进攻。

entry.def: To blast someone or something means to criticize them strongly.

example.ex: Football: Taylor blasts Beck...
example.tran: 足球：泰勒炮轰贝克。

example.ex: The Department of Health and a top immunologist have blasted a report in last week's Sunday Times.
example.tran: 卫生部和一位知名免疫学家严词抨击了上周《星期日泰晤士报》的一篇报道。

entry.def: Some people say 'blast' to show that they are annoyed at something or someone.

example.ex: Blast! I can't do anything with this.
example.tran: 真该死！我拿这个一点办法也没有。

entry.tran: 有趣的事；开心的事；乐趣
entry.def: If you say that something was a blast, you mean that you enjoyed it very much.

example.ex: Making the album was a real blast.
example.tran: 做这个专辑真是一种乐趣。

entry.tran: 以最大音量；以最大功率
entry.def: If something such as a radio or a heater is on full blast, or at full blast, it is producing as much sound or power as it is able to.

example.ex: In many of those homes the television is on full blast 24 hours a day...
example.tran: 那些家庭有很多一天24小时把电视开到最大音量。

example.ex: You are unlikely to run the heater at full blast for long periods.
example.tran: 你不太可能长时间把加热器开到最大挡位。

entry.tran: 岁月回响（勾起回忆的老歌、旧时尚等）
entry.def: You can use a blast from the past as a light-hearted way of referring to something such as an old song or fashion that you hear or notice again, and which reminds you of an earlier time.

means.word_mean: 1. causing injury or blight; especially affecting with sudden violence or plague or ruin;

sentences.sentence: "the blasting effects of the intense cold on the budding fruit"
"the blasting force of the wind blowing sharp needles of sleet in our faces"
"shut our ears against the blasting music from his car radio"

auth_sentence.res_content: So it will come blasting out on a massive scale.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So it will come blasting out on a massive scale.

auth_sentence.content: We will not learn until they have finished doing their blasting.
auth_sentence.res_content: We will not learn until they have finished doing their blasting.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We will not learn until they have finished doing their blasting.

auth_sentence.content: How ugly and blasting it can be, and how idly ruthless.
auth_sentence.res_content: How ugly and blasting it can be, and how idly ruthless.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How ugly and blasting it can be, and how idly ruthless.
